member.name: URL_COMPONENTS
member.summary: The URL_COMPONENTS structure contains the constituent parts of a URL. This structure is used with the and functions.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.dwStructSize
member.summary: Size of this structure, in bytes. Used for version checking. The size of this structure must be set to initialize this structure properly.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.lpszScheme
member.summary: Pointer to a string value that contains the scheme name.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.dwSchemeLength
member.summary: Length of the scheme name, in characters.

summary.para: Internet protocol scheme. This member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: The Internet scheme is the HTTP protocol. See RFC 2616 for more information.
The Internet scheme, HTTPS, is an HTTP protocol that uses secure transaction semantics.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.lpszHostName
member.summary: Pointer to a string value that contains the host name.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.dwHostNameLength
member.summary: Length of the host name, in characters.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.lpszUserName
member.summary: Pointer to a string that contains the user name.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.dwUserNameLength
member.summary: Length of the user name, in characters.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.lpszPassword
member.summary: Pointer to a string that contains the password.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.dwPasswordLength
member.summary: Length of the password, in characters.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.lpszUrlPath
member.summary: Pointer to a string that contains the URL path.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.dwUrlPathLength
member.summary: Length of the URL path, in characters.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.lpszExtraInfo
member.summary: Pointer to a string value that contains the extra information, for example, ?something or #something.

member.name: URL_COMPONENTS.dwExtraInfoLength
member.summary: Unsigned long integer value that contains the length of the extra information, in characters.
